lenders.name: Ruth
lenders.loan_because:
Because we are a matrix with some very BIG differences

* It costs you nothing to join - BBC is completely free!
* There are no monthly fees - ever.
* There are no upgrade fees
* We don’t sell anything
* ..and - you will never be asked to buy anything

Upline & Downline
We just ask you to agree to a simple request …
When asked to do so, you agree to donate an amount of $2.00 to $5.00 to another member on his or her Birthday.

The members to whom you will donate will be

* Your upline - a maximum of nine people
* The first level of your personal network - a maximum of three people
lenders.occupational_info:
Hi - I’m Ruthsella and my Birthday is on 26th June

Just imagine - you wake up and it’s Your Birthday!

You get up, switch on your PC and check your mail - and there are thousands of emails from friends who have sent you cash!

It’s not a dream - it really can happen!

lenders.name: Rashied
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the world.  I want it to mean something that I lived in the world once.
lenders.occupational_info: I am part of the management of a hospital's organizational operations. My area of responsibility is regulated/hazardous medical waste, infection control, and environmental care.

lenders.name: Bharat
lenders.loan_because: A little money from America goes a long way in some parts of the world...because Kiva combines the best of idealism and basic humanity with the brilliance of MFI to make a great impact on people's lives all over the world...Long live social entrepreneurship!!!

lenders.name: janice
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful gift of hope.
lenders.occupational_info: High School Wellness Education Administrator (Health and Physical Education)

lenders.name: Bernhard
lenders.loan_because:
I loan primarily to loan groups with people who have independent purposes for their loans, not just a single business, offer a group guarantee, and live in countries that are below HDI (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Development_Index) 150. I may make exceptions to this rule.

The reason why I loan is that the categorical imperative (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Categorical_imperative) demands that you cannot rely on the government alone to support people in developing countries.
lenders.occupational_info:
I write books and articles for the Wikimedia Foundation, which are then made available for free.
(For example http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Parent_Education_Course_Writer's_Guide)

lenders.name: Stefan
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Myra
lenders.loan_because: I care

lenders.name: Marco Antonio
lenders.loan_because: It´s important to give back, to involve more with the world around us

lenders.name: Sheryl
lenders.loan_because: I have been inspired by my dad, Gene Dunlap, to take a look around and share the wealth.  My dad always encouraged me to pay attention to the positive and move past the negative.  I hope to set an example that will encourage others to think positively and to believe in their own strength as my dad did for me.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I feel grateful to be able to share my resources with others in a way that contributes to a better world.

lenders.name: Philip
lenders.loan_because: I like to help.

lenders.loan_because: I have been given much.

lenders.loan_because: We by virtue of being born in the USA have been given so much, that it is not only fair, but a moral obligation to help where we can.
lenders.occupational_info: Helping people help themself to become self sufficient,productive,and build stable lives and communities.

lenders.name: Montero
lenders.loan_because: thanks to the Engelstein family, especially Sydney, and because helping women thrive economically in developing countries is one of the best ways to change the world for good.

lenders.name: Phyllis
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I mother five children.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: As a Christian, I am called to serve others.  I believe Kiva's approach is a great one because it focuses on those who have shown they are willing to work for their living rather than just asking for a handout, and it allows a single donation to keep helping new people indefinitely.
lenders.occupational_info: I write software for a technology company that makes tools which help all sorts of companies develop new products in many industries, including medical, scientific and industrial.

lenders.name: Patti
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea that I am helping a specific person and that I can afford to give an amount that will really make a difference to them.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in home health, taking care of patients with a variety of health situations.  I love the one-on-one care.

lenders.occupation: Production department of a theatre company
lenders.loan_because: I know I can't change everything, but this way I can make a difference to someone, and that matters.

lenders.loan_because: I know how it feels to be able to expand your business if only you had enough money.  I understand how difficult it can be to get a loan, particularly if you happen to be an older woman, so like to help out when I can.

lenders.name: Meera
lenders.loan_because: We are all creations of God with beauty in us, and we are equal. It's not fair that some people can't get loans because of where they live, and microcredit is a great way of helping to live out the fact that we are all of equal worth.
lenders.occupational_info: I am trying to follow Jesus, and am a nurse by profession. I try to receive God's Kingdom on earth, and sharing wealth is one way of doing that.

lenders.name: Catharine

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: My Soul is prompting me to do this...

lenders.name: Tara
lenders.loan_because: I would like to help families throughout the world enhance their quality of life and help fund better education for the children.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a married mother of three boys. We are involved in agriculture, raising cattle. The boys help my husband and I with the family ranch. I am also employed as asixth grade teacher. My day begins well before the sun comes up doing chores and milking my cow. I then set out for school which is 45 minutes away. I enjoy teaching through the day and return home in the evening to milk once again. Weekends are very busy working on the ranch taking care of the cattle ensuring that all their needs are met.

lenders.name: for my sister
lenders.loan_because: We are all connected to each other.

lenders.occupational_info: I am an eigth grade student.  I have studied Spanish for the last 8 years.  My passion is helping women and children in Spanish speaking counties.

We live in a world where you can get killed by a random stranger for 1 dollar.

lenders.name: Anna
lenders.loan_because: I would like to help make a little difference

lenders.name: TJay
lenders.loan_because: KIVA makes it so easy to let us bridge the gap between the poverty cycle and empowering personal development.

lenders.name: Ariel
lenders.loan_because: we gotta invest in each other!
lenders.occupational_info: I study history because I want to be able to teach young people about the past.

lenders.name: Bruce
lenders.loan_because: I am not a wealthy person. After I pay my bills my wife and I must be careful with the money we have left. Before Kiva, I believed we could loan a little, if it would help, but I didn't think our few dollars would be of use to anyone. We felt powerless to change the world, in any way. Kiva has given me hope that the efforts of even a few people, pooling our little capital does can change the world. I pray that the pooled pennies of an ever growing community of lenders will empower our clients. I pray our borrowers will prosper and become lenders so that their neighbors also may succeed. I loan because I am a crazy optomist who prays the pennies Kiva members suffer to share in loans sends a powerful message to everyone. The world can be a big dangerous place with lots of hate, prejudice, greed and wars. I hope the message people get is your best bet when you need a friend is the person, or organization that treated you like a friend, even though you were a stranger.
lenders.occupational_info: Disabled

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: it is an easy way to make an impact on those who are less fortunate than myself, who are actively trying to better themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach children math, reading, writing, science, and social studies.
